Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> Alot of times when you restore seeds in mobile wallets your phone's keyboard auto corrects the first word's letter to a capital, thinking you're typing a sentence. That's usually why the seeds "dont work" because its technically different, so just be mindful of that (re @BrokenBank: Think I'll just keep funds on the agama desktop wallet.)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> the middle finger ü§£ (re @BrokenBank: This worked üñï)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <PTYX11> We're working on a better system for restoration of seeds. (re @Regnar: Alot of times when you restore seeds in mobile wallets your phone's keyboard auto corrects the first word's letter to a capital, thinking you're typing a sentence. That's usually why the seeds "dont work" because its technically different, so just be mindful of that)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <PTYX11> If the keys are generated in Chameleon or Agama we will add a visual selection instead of having the user type it out. It should minimize user errors.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> üëç also a good idea security wise to not type out the full seed. Keyboards save word patterns, so if someone steals your phone they can try some words and see if there's a trend of seed words, or word recommendations that don't make sense lol (re @PTYX11: If the keys are generated in Chameleon or Agama we will add a visual selection instead of having the user type it out. It should minimize user errors.)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <BrokenBank> So much to learn about this project. To be honest I've only recently noticed it.
I've grabbed 500 KMD and will just hold onto them and forget them. Keep them staking away and hopefully in a couple of years it's paid off as I can see so many projects wanting to build on KMD.
One question though. It's POS, but is it almost a hybrid POW/POS based on the fact that it's secured on top of the Bitcoin network hash rate??

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <Regnar> It is not PoS (re @BrokenBank: So much to learn about this project. To be honest I've only recently noticed it.
I've grabbed 500 KMD and will just hold onto them and forget them. Keep them staking away and hopefully in a couple of years it's paid off as I can see so many projects wanting to build on KMD.
One question though. It's POS, but is it almost a hybrid POW/POS based on the fact that it's secured on top of the Bitcoin network hash rate??)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <BrokenBank> How do we stake for rewards then? (re @Regnar: It is not PoS)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <BrokenBank> The 5%

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> KMD is dPoW, its PoW with notarizations to protect the hashrate. The rewards you can accrue are not staking rewards.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <BrokenBank> Ahhh ok

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <BrokenBank> Thank you

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <BrokenBank> I have a lot of reading to do

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> Theres a feature called nTimelock. Basically a transaction that sets the time lock will start accruing KMD from an hour after the transaction up to 1 month, and then it stops accruing unless you claim the rewards and set the timelock again by claiming, or sending a transaction to yourself.
